result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew S. Gould was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  
No sentence credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Provide a DNA sample. Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant to complete an Anger Management Assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

Remaining 20 days can be fulfilled with 160 hours of community service. Defendant chooses community service.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew S. Gould

records.addlTxt: Time to Pay Summary mailed to defendant
See plea hearing on 8/2/22 as to the details of the waiver.

2:34 PM cases 21CM698, 22CF32, 22CF537, 22CF557, 22CF615 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew S. Gould in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Andrew S. Gould. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defense makes corrections to the plea questionnaire/waiver of rights on the record. 

In 22CF557, 22CF537, 22CF615: Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearings and Court accepts waivers. 

Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
In 22CF615: Defendant pleads No Contest to Counts 1, 4, and 5 as charged in the Information. 
In 22CF557: Defendant pleads No Contest to Counts 1 and 5 as charged in the Information. 
In 22CF32: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2 as charged in the Information. 
In 22CF537: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the Information. 
In 21CM698: Defendant pleads No Contest to Counts 1 charged in the Criminal Complaint. 
Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant Guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
The State, the Defense and the Defendant make statements before sentencing. 
Court finds joint recommendation reasonable. 

As to counts 4 and 5 in 22CF615: Court orders court costs including applicable surcharges and a DNA sample. 

As to Count 1 in 22CF557, Count 1 in 22CF615, Count 1 in 22CF537: 
Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 4 years with conditions: 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant to write an apology letter to the law enforcement officer involved in case 22CF557 within 30 days. 
Defendant to complete an Anger Management Assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
Complete AODA within 6 months and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant to pay court costs including applicable surcharges. 
As to Count 1 in 22CF615 only: 180 days in Jail with Huber, 160 days are stayed pending further order of the court.
Remaining 20 days can be fulfilled with 160 hours of community service. Defendant chooses community service. 

As to all remaining misdemeanors to which the defendant was found guilty: 
Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 2 years with conditions: 
All conditions of felony probation apply except jail time. 
Additional conditions include: 
Write letters of apology to B.J., J.K. and L.K. to be submitted through the probation agent. 
No contact with J.K., L.K. or B.J. or their residences. 
Defendant to pay court costs on all counts. 

In the event that probation is revoked sentence credit is: 
In 22CF615: 0
In 22CF557: 2 days
In 22CF32: 9 days
In 22CF537: 6 days 
In 21CM698: 11 days
Initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:30 PM cases 21CM698, 22CF32, 22CF537, 22CF557, 22CF615 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew S. Gould appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Andrew S. Gould. Parties have an agreement but paperwork needs to be completed. 
A plea hearing is scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 2:30 PM (in person) 22CF615 still needs an initial appearance- Defendant has not yet seen the complaint.
Initial appearance on July 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:30 AM cases 21CM698, 22CF32 called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew S. Gould not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Andrew S. Gould. 
Defense advises the defendant is in a treatment facility. State moves to quash warrants in other files. Defense advises they believe the matters will resolve the matters ahead of the jury trial. Defendant will be released from treatment 8/20/22. 
10:34 AM Defendant Andrew S. Gould in court. Defense requests time with his client. 
10:36 AM back on the record. Defense advises there will be an agreement to resolve all of the defendant's files. 
Warrants in 22CF537, 22CF557, and 22CF615 are quashed. 
All files: A status conference (likely plea) is scheduled for 7/27/22 at 2:30 PM (in person). 
Trial is to remain on the calendar for now.

9:55 AM Cases called: 22CF537, 22CF557 & 22CF615. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Andrew S. Gould. Defendant Andrew S. Gould not in court. 
Warrant ordered in all three cases.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
Initial appearance on June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 11:37 AM.
Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew S. Gould not in court. 
State notes the Defendant has hearings scheduled on other matters on 6/29/22 at 9:30 AM.
Court orders this case to go in at that date/time.
Adjourned Initial Appearance: 6/29/22 at 9:30 AM.
